title: Senior .NET Architect (Team Lead)
description: **Job Title**: Lead .NET Architect (Microservices Team) **Company**: EmpowerID - A Pioneer in Cloud Identity Solutions **Location**: Remote (must be willing to work full-time on EST or CET time zone). Preference given to applicants legally allowed to work in Europe. This position would be long-term and the expectation is that it is your only job. **Job Description**: EmpowerID is inviting experienced .NET architects to join our team and lead the development of our microservices-based platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in microservices architecture, cloud computing, DevOps practices, and deep expertise in the .NET ecosystem. **Responsibilities**: - Play a lead role on our product development team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. - Design, implement and optimize scalable, maintainable microservices-based architectures for our cloud identity solutions. - Develop and maintain high-quality, efficient, and reliable code in C# .NET. - Implement modern software development practices, such as continuous integration and delivery. - Collaborate with team members to develop software that meets our clients' cloud identity requirements. - Implement robust security and authorization mechanisms using OpenID Connect, OAuth 2.0 and JSON Web Tokens (JWT). - Design and optimize efficient, reliable APIs. - Improve database interactions using modern data access technologies. - Containerize applications and deploying them to Azure Kubernetes. - Monitor application performance and troubleshoot problems. - Ensure high code quality, best practices, and consistent development standards across the team. **Required Skills and Qualifications**: - At least 3 years of experience in a team lead role mentoring developers, designing architectures, and performing code reviews. - 8+ years of experience in software development, with at least 5 years of experience in .NET development. - Strong background in microservices architecture, cloud computing, and DevOps practices. - Experience with Azure services such as Azure Service Bus, Azure Active Directory, and Azure DevOps. - Proficient with C# .NET. - Strong experience with ASP.NET Core and RESTful API development. - Deep understanding of authentication and authorization using OAuth 2.0 and JSON Web Tokens (JWT). - Experience with Docker and containerization technologies. - Experience with agile development methodologies, including continuous integration and delivery. - Strong communication and problem-solving skills. - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field. **Preferred Skills and Qualifications**: - Experience with Large Language Models and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies, including machine learning and natural language processing (e.g. OpenAI, ChatGPT, Langchain, etc.). - Understanding of the application of AI in enhancing software solutions and optimizing operations. - Experience with Identity and Access Management **Hiring Process**: Applicants for this position will be asked to perform a paid hands-on coding test that can be completed in 14 hours or less. The hiring process will also include technical and HR interviews. EmpowerID is excited about bringing onboard a skilled .NET architect with a passion for cloud identity solutions, microservices architecture, and cloud computing. If you're eager to work on cutting-edge software projects in the identity space, we invite you to apply now!
